column4: nvidia-glx does not work.  can anyone with an nvidia card(6xxx) help me get a graphical interface?
Of course, you could run 'dpkg -i <package list>' as well.
though I get dependency problems when I do that
Did you download the *correct* OOo packages?
depends on what you mean by "correct" I downloaded the OpenOffice 2 final release packages made by doko
Are they designed for your specific ubuntu release?
I suppose this is why they aren't working :)
If you have packages for breezy, they won't work.
how would I upgrade to breezy? I'm on dialup -- my friends has 5.10 cds, should I just get a cd from him and upgrade somehow?
Yes, get a CD, insert, click 'Upgrade' (I think)
_jason, crimsun, etc: thanks for the help, I'll get the CD from my friend tomorrow and then upgrade and hopefully these packages will work then :)
